unnormalised: New Delhi, 17/07/2024 – The Ministry of Culture has officially announced the dates for the annual "Bharat Utsav," a week-long celebration of Indian arts and heritage. The event is scheduled to commence on 26/01/2025, coinciding with Republic Day, and will conclude on 02/02/2025.
normalised: New Delhi, seventeenth July two thousand and twenty four – The Ministry of Culture has officially announced the dates for the annual "Bharat Utsav," a week-long celebration of Indian arts and heritage. The event is scheduled to commence on twenty sixth January two thousand and twenty five, coinciding with Republic Day, and will conclude on second February two thousand and twenty five.

unnormalised: The Utsav, which is expected to draw crowds of over 5 lakh visitors, will feature performances from renowned artists across various disciplines, including classical music, dance, theatre, and traditional crafts. Key venues for the event include India Gate, the National Museum, and several auditoriums across the capital city.
normalised: The Utsav, which is expected to draw crowds of over five hundred thousand visitors, will feature performances from renowned artists across various disciplines, including classical music, dance, theatre, and traditional crafts. Key venues for the event include India Gate, the National Museum, and several auditoriums across the capital city.

unnormalised: According to a press release issued at 11:00 AM today, security measures will be heightened throughout the week, with special attention given to crowd management and traffic flow. The Delhi Police has collaborated with the organizers to ensure a safe and enjoyable experience for all attendees.
normalised: According to a press release issued at eleven a.m. today, security measures will be heightened throughout the week, with special attention given to crowd management and traffic flow. The Delhi Police has collaborated with the organizers to ensure a safe and enjoyable experience for all attendees.

unnormalised: A special highlight of this year's event is the "Indian Heritage Exhibition," which will showcase artifacts and historical documents dating back to the Maurya Empire. The exhibition will be open to the public from 10:00 AM to 6:00 PM daily throughout the Utsav.
normalised: A special highlight of this year's event is the "Indian Heritage Exhibition," which will showcase artifacts and historical documents dating back to the Maurya Empire. The exhibition will be open to the public from ten a.m. to six p.m. daily throughout the Utsav.

unnormalised: The closing ceremony, slated for 7:30 PM on 02/02/2025, will feature a performance by the celebrated Bollywood singer, Ms. Alka Yagnik. The event is expected to be attended by several dignitaries, including the President of India and the Prime Minister.
normalised: The closing ceremony, slated for seven thirty p.m. on second February two thousand and twenty five, will feature a performance by the celebrated Bollywood singer, M-S. Alka Yagnik. The event is expected to be attended by several dignitaries, including the President of India and the Prime Minister.

unnormalised: Organizers are advising attendees to pre-book tickets for all events, as seating capacity is limited. Tickets can be purchased online via the official Bharat Utsav website, which went live at 9:00 AM this morning.
normalised: Organizers are advising attendees to pre-book tickets for all events, as seating capacity is limited. Tickets can be purchased online via the official Bharat Utsav website, which went live at nine a.m. this morning.

unnormalised: The Ministry of Tourism anticipates that the event will generate revenue of over Rs. 50 crore, boosting the local economy and promoting India's rich cultural heritage on a global scale. Updates on the event schedule and any potential changes will be announced daily at 2:00 PM via the Ministry's official Twitter handle.
normalised: The Ministry of Tourism anticipates that the event will generate revenue of over rupee fifty crore, boosting the local economy and promoting India's rich cultural heritage on a global scale. Updates on the event schedule and any potential changes will be announced daily at two p.m. via the Ministry's official Twitter handle.

unnormalised: Preparations are already underway to transform Delhi into a vibrant hub of cultural activity in anticipation of the Bharat Utsav. Authorities are hopeful for a resounding success and are looking forward to welcoming participants from across the country and abroad. The Utsav is prepone to Jan 2025 from the speculated Feb 2025.
normalised: Preparations are already underway to transform Delhi into a vibrant hub of cultural activity in anticipation of the Bharat Utsav. Authorities are hopeful for a resounding success and are looking forward to welcoming participants from across the country and abroad. The Utsav is prepone to January two thousand and twenty five from the speculated February two thousand and twenty five.
